_header: Sir Nuns Priest our Host said anon
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the ‘Nun’s Priest’s Epilogue’ of the Canterbury Tales found in nine manuscripts and three pre-1500 printed editions — 16 lines in couplets, possibly canceled and reworked for the Monk’s Prologue

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
Sire Nonnes preest oure hoost seyde a noneY blessed be thy breth
                    & euery stoone…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…And aftir he with full mery chereSaide vnto a nother as ye
                    shulle here
OxfChrCh152.Attributed Title: Here is ended the Nonnes prestes tale… (rubric, f. 174)

CULDd424.First Lines:
Sire Nonnes Preest oure hoost seide a noonI blissed be thy breche
                    & euery ston…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…And after that he with ful merie chereSeide vn to a nother as
                    ȝe shuln heere…
CULDd424.Attributed Title:
Heere endeth the Tale of the Nonnes Preest (f. 195v, preceded by
                    blank space of ca. 15 lines)
CULDd424.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Cambridge MS. Dd.4.24 of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales,
                Completed by the Egerton MS. 2726 (The Haistwell MS).
The Chaucer Society
         1st Series, no. 95 (Part 1, issue for 1901) and 96 (Part 2, issue for
            1902).

BLAdd5140.First Lines:
SIr Nvnnys preest oure host seide anoonI blessid be thi breche and
                    every stoon…
BLAdd5140.Last Lines:
…And aftir that he wt full mery cheereSeid vnto the Nunne as
                    ye may heere

BLEge2726.First Lines:
Sire Nonnes Preest our hoost seid anoonYblessed be thy breche and
                    euery stoon…
BLEge2726.Last Lines:
…And after þat he with full mery chereSeid vn to another
                    as ye shull here
BLEge2726.Attributed Title:
Hic fabula Monialis Presbiteri desinit & Incipit fabula / Sancte
                        Cecilie prologo deficiente & per secundam monialem narrata (f.
                    217)
BLEge2726.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Cambridge MS. Dd.4.24 of Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales,
                Completed by the Egerton MS. 2726 (The Haistwell MS).
The Chaucer Society
         1st Series, no. 95 (Part 1, issue for 1901) and 96 (Part 2, issue for

BLEge2864.First Lines:
Sir nunnes preest our hoost seid a noonI blissid be thi breeth and
                    every stoon…
BLEge2864.Last Lines:
…And aftir that he with ful mery cheerSeyde vn to the Nunne as
                    ye shal heer

BLRoy17Dxv.First Lines:
Sir Nonnes prist our host sayde anonI blessid be thy breche and
                    euery stoon…
BLRoy17Dxv.Last Lines:
…And after that he with ful myrry chiereSayde vnto another as
                    ye shul here
BLRoy17Dxv.Attributed Title:
Here endith the tale of þe / none prest… (rubric, in margin, f.
                    284)

RylandsEng113.First Lines:
Sir Nonnes prest or hoste seid anoonBlissed be þi breche and
                    euery stoon…
RylandsEng113.Last Lines:
…And after þat he with full mery chereSeid vnto þe
                    Nonne as ye shal here
RylandsEng113.Attributed Title:
Here endith þe tale of þe Nonnes Prest… (f.
                    153v)

Austin143.First Lines:
[S]yre Nonnys prest oure hoste sayd a nonBlessyd be thy Breche and
                    euery stone…
Austin143.Last Lines:
…And he after þat with ffull mery chereSayd vn to the
                    Nonne as y shall here
Austin143.Attributed Title:
Verba Hospitis (margin, f. 194); Here endyth the Tall of the Nonnys
                    prest… (f. 194)

TokyoTak24.First Lines:
Sir Nonnes prest oure oost anonI blessed be thi breche and eueri
                    ston…
TokyoTak24.Last Lines:
…And aftir that he with full mery chereSeid vnto anothir as ye
                    shal hiere
TokyoTak24.Attributed Title:
Hic fabula Monialis Presbiteri desinit / Et incipit fabula Sancte
                        Cecilie prologo / deficiente et per secundum Monialem narrata… (f.
                        213v)
